translations.literal: Lord Shang was an illegitimate son of a minor branch of the Wei nobility. His name was Yang, his surname Gongsun, and his ancestors originally bore the Ji surname.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Shang was the illegitimate son of a minor noble from Wei. His name was Yang, his surname Gongsun, and his ancestors originally bore the Ji surname.

translations.chinese: 鞅少好刑名之學，事魏相公叔座為中庶子。
translations.literal: From a young age, Yang was fascinated by the study of law and political philosophy. He served as a junior aide to Gongshu Zuo, the chancellor of Wei.
translations.idiomatic: From youth, Yang was devoted to the study of law and governance. He served as a junior aide to Gongshu Zuo, chancellor of Wei.

context.previous: 商君者，衛之諸庶孽公子也，名鞅，姓公孫氏，其祖本姬姓也。

translations.chinese: 公叔座知其賢，未及進。
translations.literal: Gongshu Zuo recognized Yang's exceptional abilities but had not yet promoted him.
translations.idiomatic: Gongshu Zuo recognized Yang's talent but had not yet promoted him.

context.previous: 鞅少好刑名之學，事魏相公叔座為中庶子。

translations.literal: Just then Zuo fell ill, King Hui of Wei personally went to inquire after his illness, said: 'If chancellor should die, what shall we do for the state?'
translations.idiomatic: Just then Gongshu fell ill. King Hui of Wei went in person to inquire after his health and asked, "If the chancellor should pass away, what will become of the state?"

context.previous: 公叔座知其賢，未及進。

translations.literal: Gongshu said: 'My junior aide Gongsun Yang, though young, has extraordinary talent, I wish Your Majesty would entrust the entire state to him.'
translations.idiomatic: Gongshu replied, "My junior aide, Gongsun Yang, is young but possesses extraordinary talent. I urge Your Majesty to entrust the entire state to his care."

translations.chinese: 王嘿然。
translations.literal: The king fell silent.
translations.idiomatic: The king fell silent.

translations.literal: The king was about to leave when Zuo dismissed his attendants and said: 'If Your Majesty does not employ Yang, you must kill him, do not let him leave the borders.'
translations.idiomatic: As the king was about to depart, Gongshu dismissed his attendants and said in private, "If Your Majesty will not employ Yang, then you must kill him. Do not allow him to leave our borders."

context.previous: 王嘿然。

translations.chinese: 王許諾而去。
translations.literal: The king agreed and left.
translations.idiomatic: The king agreed and departed.

translations.literal: Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized: 'Just now when the king asked who could be chancellor, I recommended you, but the king's expression did not approve.
translations.idiomatic: Gongshu Zuo summoned Yang and apologized, saying, "Just now when the king asked who could serve as chancellor, I recommended you. But his expression showed he did not approve.

context.previous: 王許諾而去。

translations.chinese: 我方先君後臣，因謂王即弗用鞅，當殺之。
translations.literal: I put loyalty to the ruler above ministerial friendship, so I told the king that if he would not employ you, he should have you killed.
translations.idiomatic: I place loyalty to the ruler above friendship with ministers, so I told the king that if he would not employ you, he should execute you.

context.previous: 公叔座召鞅謝曰：「今者王問可以為相者，我言若，王色不許我。

translations.chinese: 王許我。
translations.literal: The king agreed.
translations.idiomatic: The king agreed with me.

translations.literal: You should leave quickly, you will soon be captured.'
translations.idiomatic: You should leave at once—you will soon be arrested."

translations.chinese: 鞅曰：「彼王不能用君之言任臣，又安能用君之言殺臣乎？」
translations.literal: Yang said: 'If he cannot employ you by following your recommendation to use me, how can he employ you by following your recommendation to kill me?'
translations.idiomatic: Yang replied, "If the king cannot follow your advice to employ me, how can he follow your advice to kill me?"

translations.literal: In the end, Yang did not leave.
translations.idiomatic: In the end, he did not leave.

translations.chinese: 惠王既去，而謂左右曰：「公叔病甚，悲乎，欲令寡人以國聽公孫鞅也，豈不悖哉！」
translations.literal: King Hui having departed, he told his attendants: 'Gongshu is gravely ill, how lamentable, he wants me to entrust the state to Gongsun Yang, is this not absurd!'
translations.idiomatic: After King Hui left, he remarked to his attendants, "Gongshu is gravely ill—how unfortunate! He wants me to entrust the entire state to Gongsun Yang. Is this not madness?"

context.previous: 卒不去。

translations.chinese: 公叔既死，公孫鞅聞秦孝公下令國中求賢者，將修繆公之業，東復侵地，乃遂西入秦，因孝公寵臣景監以求見孝公。
translations.literal: Gongshu having died, Gongsun Yang heard that Duke Xiao of Qin had issued an edict throughout the state seeking worthy men, intending to revive Duke Mu's achievements and eastward recover lost territories, so he went west to Qin, through Duke Xiao's favored minister Jing Jian to seek audience with Duke Xiao.
translations.idiomatic: After Gongshu's death, Gongsun Yang learned that Duke Xiao of Qin had issued an edict throughout his realm seeking talented men. The duke intended to revive Duke Mu's legacy and recover territories lost to the east. Yang traveled west to Qin and, through the duke's favored minister Jing Jian, sought an audience with Duke Xiao.

context.next: 孝公既見衛鞅，語事良久，孝公時時睡，弗聽。

translations.chinese: 孝公既見衛鞅，語事良久，孝公時時睡，弗聽。
translations.literal: Duke Xiao granted Wei Yang an audience. They spoke of state affairs for a long time, but the duke kept dozing off and paid no attention.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao granted an audience to Wei Yang. They discussed state affairs for a long time, but the duke kept nodding off and paid no attention.

context.previous: 公叔既死，公孫鞅聞秦孝公下令國中求賢者，將修繆公之業，東復侵地，乃遂西入秦，因孝公寵臣景監以求見孝公。

translations.chinese: 罷而孝公怒景監曰：「子之客妄人耳，安足用邪！」
translations.literal: Retiring, Duke Xiao angrily rebuked Jing Jian: 'Your guest is a charlatan, how can he be employed!'
translations.idiomatic: After the audience ended, Duke Xiao angrily rebuked Jing Jian, saying, "Your guest is nothing but a charlatan! How could he possibly be of use?"

context.previous: 孝公既見衛鞅，語事良久，孝公時時睡，弗聽。
context.next: 景監以讓衛鞅。

translations.chinese: 景監以讓衛鞅。
translations.literal: Jing Jian conveyed this criticism to Wei Yang.
translations.idiomatic: Jing Jian conveyed this rebuke to Wei Yang.

translations.chinese: 衛鞅曰：「吾說公以帝道，其志不開悟矣。」
translations.literal: Wei Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the emperor, his will is not enlightened.'
translations.idiomatic: Wei Yang replied, "I counseled him with the imperial way, but his mind remains unenlightened."

context.previous: 景監以讓衛鞅。
context.next: 後五日，復求見鞅。

translations.chinese: 後五日，復求見鞅。
translations.literal: Five days later, Yang again requested an audience.
translations.idiomatic: Five days later, he again requested an audience with Yang.

context.previous: 衛鞅曰：「吾說公以帝道，其志不開悟矣。」

translations.chinese: 鞅復見孝公，益愈，然而未中旨。
translations.literal: Yang met with Duke Xiao again and spoke even more eloquently, but still failed to win his approval.
translations.idiomatic: Yang met with Duke Xiao again and spoke even more persuasively, but still did not gain his approval.

context.previous: 後五日，復求見鞅。
context.next: 罷而孝公復讓景監，景監亦讓鞅。

translations.chinese: 罷而孝公復讓景監，景監亦讓鞅。
translations.literal: After the audience, Duke Xiao again scolded Jing Jian, who in turn scolded Yang.
translations.idiomatic: After the audience ended, Duke Xiao again rebuked Jing Jian, who in turn rebuked Yang.

translations.literal: Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of the king but it did not enter.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said, "I counseled him with the royal way, but it did not resonate.

context.previous: 罷而孝公復讓景監，景監亦讓鞅。
context.next: 請復見鞅。」

translations.chinese: 請復見鞅。」
translations.literal: Please let me see him again.'
translations.idiomatic: Please allow me to see him once more."

context.previous: 鞅曰：「吾說公以王道而未入也。
context.next: 鞅復見孝公，孝公善之而未用也。

translations.chinese: 鞅復見孝公，孝公善之而未用也。
translations.literal: Yang met with Duke Xiao once more. The duke was pleased but still did not offer him a position.
translations.idiomatic: Yang met with Duke Xiao once more. The duke was pleased with him but still did not employ him.

context.previous: 請復見鞅。」
context.next: 罷而去。

translations.chinese: 罷而去。
translations.literal: The audience ended and Yang departed.
translations.idiomatic: The audience ended and he departed.

context.previous: 鞅復見孝公，孝公善之而未用也。

translations.chinese: 孝公謂景監曰：「汝客善，可與語矣。」
translations.literal: Duke Xiao told Jing Jian: 'Your guest is good, one can converse with him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao told Jing Jian, "Your guest is impressive—one can actually hold a conversation with him."

context.previous: 罷而去。

translations.literal: Yang said: 'I advised him with the way of hegemony, his intention desires to employ it.
translations.idiomatic: Yang said, "I counseled him with the way of hegemony. His intentions now favor employing me.

context.previous: 孝公謂景監曰：「汝客善，可與語矣。」
context.next: 誠復見我，我知之矣。」

translations.chinese: 誠復見我，我知之矣。」
translations.literal: If he truly sees me again, I will know it.'
translations.idiomatic: If he truly invites me back, I will know for certain."

context.previous: 鞅曰：「吾說公以霸道，其意欲用之矣。

translations.literal: Wei Yang met with Duke Xiao once more.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Yang met with Duke Xiao once more.

translations.literal: As they conversed, the duke unconsciously leaned forward on his mat.
translations.idiomatic: As they spoke, the duke unconsciously leaned forward on his mat.

translations.literal: They spoke for several days without growing weary.
translations.idiomatic: They spoke for several days without wearying.

translations.literal: Jing Jian said: 'How did you hit upon our lord's pleasure?
translations.idiomatic: Jing Jian asked, "How did you manage to please our lord?

context.previous: 語數日不厭。
context.next: 吾君之驩甚也。」

translations.chinese: 吾君之驩甚也。」
translations.literal: Our lord's delight is extreme.'
translations.idiomatic: Our lord's delight is quite extraordinary."

translations.idiomatic: Yang replied, "I first counseled the lord with the ways of emperors and kings, comparing them to the Three Dynasties. But the lord said, 'Too distant—I cannot wait.

translations.idiomatic: Moreover, worthy rulers make their names illustrious throughout the world in their own lifetimes. How can they gloomily wait decades or centuries to achieve imperial greatness?'

translations.literal: Therefore, I counseled him with methods to strengthen the state, and the lord was greatly pleased.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I advised him with methods to strengthen the state, and my lord was greatly pleased with them.

translations.idiomatic: However, it is hard to compare virtue with Yin and Zhou.'

translations.idiomatic: Fools are blind to accomplished facts; the wise see things at their inception.

translations.idiomatic: Therefore, if sages can strengthen the state, they do not follow old laws;

context.next: 孝公曰：「善。」

translations.literal: Sages do not change the people and teach, wise men do not alter laws and govern.

translations.idiomatic: those who govern by following established laws—officials are familiar with them and the people find peace in them.'

translations.literal: Ordinary people are at peace with old customs, scholars drown in what they have heard.
